main_text:
Logical Pluralism via Linguistic Pluralism
4. Logical Pluralism via Linguistic Pluralism

The contemporary debate over case-based logical pluralism has lead to
a revival of interest in an older form of pluralism advocated by the
famous logical positivist, Rudolf Carnap (1937: §17; 1950 [1958];
see also Restall 2002; Cook 2010; Field 2009; Kouri Kissel 2019; Varzi
2002; Eklund 2012).
hierarchy_title: Logical Pluralism || Logical Pluralism via Linguistic Pluralism
